parameters.url: =https://api.peopledatalabs.com/v5/company/enrich?website={{ $('Trigger Pipeline When Record Created In Supabase').item.json.website }}&pretty=false&titlecase=false&include_if_matched=false&min_likelihood=2

nodes.name: Search For Company On People Data Labs

parameters.content:
## Trigger Pipeline When New Supabase Record Created
We want to run the pipeline whenever a new Supabase record is created. We also want to set any local variables that we may use.

## Get Company Information And Crawl Website
We want to retrieve the company's information from People Data Labs and then use Firecrawl to scrape data from their website.

## Generate A Dossier On The Company
We want to use Google's Gemini API to generate a dossier on the company, and then we want to create an array that contains all of the dynamic fields to be updated when we are updating the Supabase record.

## Update Each Metric Using AI Agents
We want to update each of the company's fields in Supabase based on calculations we make by the AI agents.

## Generate Executive Summary For Company
We want to use Anthropic to generate a comprehensive, final summary on the company's AI and GenAI capabilities, and then update the record in Supabase.

## Summarize Certain Fields Related To The Company
We want to take certain fields from the company's record in the Supabase table, and summarize them to less than 65 characters.

nodes.name: Combine All ChatGPT Outcomes Into One Response (Scores And Justifications)

parameters.content:
## Create The PDF And Send It Out
We want to take all the information that we have and create a PDF using it. Then, we want to send out the email report.

nodes.name: Combine All ChatGPT Outcomes Into One Response (Notes)

nodes.name: Trigger Pipeline When Record Created In Supabase

conditions.keyValue: ={{ $('Trigger Pipeline When Record Created In Supabase').item.json.id }}

nodes.name: Update Supabase Record To Include Company
Get Supabase Record Based On Name

parameters.subject: =GRI Report Card for {{ $('Update Record With Summarized Notes').item.json.company }}
parameters.message:
=

Hello there!

We've just finished generating your requested GRI Report Card for {{ $('Update Record With Summarized Notes').item.json.company }}. You can find it attached to this email.

Need another report? You can easily request one by visiting: https://gri.kuiper.so/

We hope this helps!
Best,
The Kuiper AI Team

values.content: =Shrink this note to below 65 characters in length. The field name should be "{{ $json.name }}_summary".

parameters.content:
## Testing
Deactivate the Webhook trigger below and connect this trigger to the "Trigger Pipeline When Record Created In Supabase" node, and then replace the id in the "Trigger Pipeline When Record Created In Supabase" from "{{ $json.body.record.id }}" to an ID of a sample record in the Supabase current_ai_reportcard table (you can always create a new one there and just fill in website and email).

assignments.name: prompt
assignments.value:
=Input Data:
1. Company Dossier: {{ $('Generate Company Dossier').item.json.text }}
2. Research Rubric: {{ $json.name }}
3. Rubric Description: {{ $json.description }}
4. Research Grading Scale: {{ $json.grading_scale }}
   
Task Instructions:
1. Review the company dossier thoroughly.
2. Follow the research rubric and its description meticulously.
3. Conduct supplementary research to address information gaps.
4. Compile findings into a structured fact sheet.

Output Guidelines:
- Format: "[Company Name] Fact Sheet"
- Structure: Numbered sections (as per rubric), bullet points for facts
- Content: Factual, objective, up-to-date information
- Citations: Include for all additional research
- Length: Aim for 2 pages of data dense facts 

Special Considerations:
- Conflicting Information: Present all versions with respective sources
- Unavailable Information: Clearly state "Information not available" in the relevant section
- Uncertainty: Use phrases like "According to [source], potentially..." for less certain information

parameters.text:
=Compile a comprehensive, data-dense fact sheet about the target company using their website content and provided additional data. The fact sheet should be highly detailed, presented in a bullet-point format, and include information that might be relevant to the GenAI Resilience Index Scorecard criteria. 
Data Sources

COMPANY WEBSITE CONTENT:
Website content: {{ $ifEmpty($json.markdown[0], "") }}

COMPANY DATA:
website: {{ $ifEmpty($('Update Supabase Record To Include Company').item.json.website, "") }}
size: {{ $ifEmpty($('Search For Company On People Data Labs').item.json.size, "") }}
industry: {{ $ifEmpty($('Search For Company On People Data Labs').item.json.industry, "") }} {{ $ifEmpty($('Search For Company On People Data Labs').item.json.tags, "") }} {{ $ifEmpty($('Search For Company On People Data Labs').item.json.sic[0].industry_group, "") }}
description: {{ $ifEmpty($('Search For Company On People Data Labs').item.json.summary, "") }}
founded: {{ $ifEmpty($('Search For Company On People Data Labs').item.json.founded, "") }}
headquarters_city: {{ $ifEmpty($('Search For Company On People Data Labs').item.json.location.name, "") }}
employees_count: {{ $ifEmpty($('Search For Company On People Data Labs').item.json.employee_count, "") }}




Output Guidelines

Format the fact sheet as a series of detailed bullet points.
Organize information into the following categories, which align with the GenAI Resilience Index Scorecard criteria:

AI and Technology Integration
Company Strengths and Market Position
Technical Competencies and Expertise
Company Culture and Strategic Direction
Industry and Sector Information


Include as much factual data as possible, prioritizing specificity and quantitative information where available.
For each piece of information, indicate its source (website content or additional data).
Collect all relevant information without making any judgments or assessments about the company's performance or potential scores.

Information to Collect (for each category)
AI and Technology Integration

Any mentions of AI, machine learning, or generative AI in products or services
Details about AI-related projects, initiatives, or partnerships
Information about the company's technology stack or digital transformation efforts

Company Strengths and Market Position

Data on market share or industry ranking
Information about unique selling points or competitive advantages
Details about product lines, services, or solutions offered
Any data on customer base, retention, or satisfaction

Technical Competencies and Expertise

Information about the company's R&D efforts
Details on technical capabilities or specializations
Any mentions of patents, innovations, or proprietary technologies
Information about the technical background of leadership or key employees

Company Culture and Strategic Direction

Statements from leadership about company vision or future direction
Any mentions of AI or technology in the company's strategy
Information about company values, culture, or workplace initiatives
Details about recent organizational changes or new strategic focuses

Industry and Sector Information

Data on the company's industry or sector
Information about industry trends, challenges, or opportunities
Any sector-specific AI or technology adoption data
Details about regulatory environment or industry standards related to AI

Special Instructions

Collect all relevant information without attempting to analyze or interpret its significance for GenAI resilience.
If you encounter conflicting information, include all versions and cite the sources.
For any key areas where information is missing or unclear, explicitly note this in the fact sheet.
Use phrases like "According to the company website..." or "Based on provided data..." to clarify sources.
If you identify implied information, clearly label it as such.

Final Notes

Aim for exhaustive detail while maintaining clarity and organization.
Include all potentially relevant information, even if its significance isn't immediately apparent.
Your role is solely to compile and present information, not to analyze or draw conclusions.
Ensure that the fact sheet provides a comprehensive foundation for subsequent analysis by others.

Please proceed with creating the comprehensive fact sheet based on these instructions and the provided data.

values.fieldLabel: Your email address to send raport

parameters.content:
# EVERWORKER FLOW RECREATE:

### Project high LEVEL REQUIREMENTS are: 
- to save all reports (client email, tested domains, statuses etc.) in `database`
- to save all PDF generated reports IN `S3 bucket` - block storage


## This is current FLOW TO-DO:

### Prerequisite - to have database table or other similar stored data - that agents can access to read.
Fixed constants - stored `rubric_panel` data

This is current code snippet to create a database table for rubric panels in SQL:
- save DATABASE TABLE `rubric_panel`
    create table public.rubric_panel (
        id uuid not null default gen_random_uuid (),
        name text not null,
        version public.version not null,
        weight double precision not null,
        description text not null,
        grading_scale text null
    ) TABLESPACE pg_default;

## INPUT
- INPUT FROM USER: "Enter the {{URL}} of the company website to enrich"
- INPUT FROM USER: "Enter the {{email}} where the report will be sent"


- `GET API` call to https://api.peopledatalabs.com/ with {{URL}} of company
- IF API RESPONSE IS SUCCESSFUL:
    - `GET API` call https://api.firecrawl.dev/ to get webpage content data
    - `PAUSE` 20 seconds
    - `GET API` call to https://api.firecrawl.dev/ + URL report path from 1.st call
    - `GET GEMINI` API LLM AGENT req with custom prompt - pass data from earlier
    - `GET PERPLEXITY` API call with custom prompt - pass data from earlier calculations
    - `GET ANTHROPIC` API call with custom prompt - pass data from earlier + calulations + strictly defined output structure
    - `GET ANTHROPIC` API 2nd call with custom prompt - pass data + calculations from earlier
    - `GET CHATGPT` API with custom prompt - pass data from earlier
    - `GET PDF.CO` API call to generate pdf - pass data from eaclier + pdf master template file
    - `GET PDF.CO` API response with pdf binary file - to be able to save to S3
    - `POST AWS.COM` API call and pass pdf binay file - to get file saved on bucket
    - `GET GMAIL.COM` API call to send email + pdf file url to {{email}} that customer supplied in step 1
- IF API RESPONSE IS EMPTY - finish

After each step we need to `UPDATE status` in DB - for debug purposes
